title: Bella Hadid and The Weeknd aren’t ‘back on’ as he celebrates her 23rd
text:
Bella and The Weeknd are not back on, so calm down (Picture: Getty Images for People.com)

Seems Bella Hadid and The Weeknd just can’t stay away from one another, or make up their mind as to whether they want to be together or not, with reports recently claiming the two had reunited for her birthday.

It comes two months after the model and singer called it quits for another time, giving us all whiplash with their back and forth romance.

Bella celebrated her 23rd last week with a swanky event at Le Chalet, L’Avenue, and apparently The Weekend – real name Abel Tesfaye – was there to party.

Following the shindig, according to sources, the two were giving it another shot.

‘Abel met up with Bella last night for her third birthday celebration at L’Avenue,’ a source told E! News.

The pair have been on and off for years (Picture: GC Images)

‘He was with her the entire night and they left together to go back to the apartment they both shared.’

The insider adds, “You could tell that they were definitely in love and they both looked very happy being around each other.”

However, don’t get too excited, with reps insisting to People the singer attended ‘as a friend’ of Bella’s.

We can dream, though, right?

Bella celebrated big for her b-day (Picture: GC Images)

The singer also appeared to have a laugh at the speculation around his on again/off again relationship with Bella.

He wrote on Instagram: ‘Imagine obsessing over someone’s relationship that u don’t know s**t about.

He also shared a screenshot of an old Tweet that read: ‘I didn’t confirm it myself, then it is ‘not confirmed’.’

Hmm, seems he set the record straight there, then. Maybe?

The pair first connected in 2015, however they broke up in 2016 due to their busy schedules.

In 2018 they rekindled their relationship, before calling time again two months ago in August.

E! previously claimed Bella received a birthday message from her ex on her birthday.

A source said: ‘The Weeknd did reach out to Bella during the day to wish her a Happy Birthday and they have been in touch.

‘There is no bad blood between the two and they are on good terms right now. There isn’t any chance of them getting back together right now but Bella never wants to have any anger or resentment towards anyone.’

Bella was joined by older sister Gigi, 24 and her younger brother Anwar, 20, as well as mother Yolanda, for the swanky bash on Thursday night.

The Victoria’s Secret model kept her look simple but chic in a revealing black crop top and baggy black trousers, teamed with glittery heels and a statement Christian Dior choker.

Brother Anwar was joined by boo Dua Lipa who dazzled in a sequinned jacket and matching mini skirt, completing her look with tights and heels. The British singer joined other fashionable guests such as Kaia Gerber, singer Justine Skye and Victoria’s Secret models Joan Smalls and Stella Maxwell.

Metro.co.uk contacted reps for comment.
